description: Ms. codex. Title from spine label by a later hand; parts of label are worn away. The full title reads "Majmūʻat rasāʼil ʻadīdah [...]-īyah wa-khilāfihā ... [?] risālatān al-awzān wa-al-maqāyīs wa-al-darāhim." Physical description: 16-17 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on beige glazed, laid Arabic paper. Catchwords. Foliated in Western script beginning on the second leaf, with some errors. Some damp staining, particularly toward beginning and end of manuscript; marginal insect damage. Origin: All texts copied by the same scribe, Ibn Muḥammad Sharīf al-Khātūnʹābādī Muḥammad al-mulaqqab bi-al-Kāẓim, teacher at al-Masjid al-Jāmiʻ and servant of al-Rawḍah al-Riḍawīyah [Mashhad] (leaf 172a). Text 7 dated Ṣafar 1128 H [January-February 1716] (leaf 123a). Text 8 dated 25 Rabīʻ I 1128 H [19 March 1716] (leaf 172a). Text 9 dated 29 Rabīʻ I 1128 H [23 March 1716] (leaf 180b). Text 14 dated 5 Jumādá II 1128 H [27 May 1716] (leaf 215a). Remaining texts likely completed in the same year.
abstract: Collection of Shiʻite texts on legal and doctrinal matters.
contents: 16. leaves 217(bis)b-236b: Mīzān al-maqādīr fī tibyān al-taqādīr / Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan Aghā Raḍī al-Dīn.
extent: 240 leaves : paper ; 182 x 122 (109-112 x 65-75) mm bound to 184 x 125 mm
title: [Majmūʻat rasāʼil ʻadīdah ...].
provenance: Acquired by Robert Garrett from Brill, 1925, from the books of Murād Bey al-Bārūdī (Beirut).
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Full brown leather with crude blind-stamped diamonds on the covers.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
